story:
Once upon a time, in a land far, far away, there was a beautiful and peaceful valley surrounded by towering mountains. The valley was known as Bamiyan, and it was home to a kind and gentle people who lived in harmony with the land and with each other.

The people of Bamiyan were known far and wide for their exceptional skills in creating the most magnificent and breathtaking statues out of clay and stone. These statues were not just ordinary sculptures, but rather, they were living, breathing embodiments of ancient wisdom and teachings.

Among the people of Bamiyan, there was a young boy named Ali, who was known for his quick wit and boundless curiosity. Ali's father was a master sculptor, and from a very young age, Ali would watch his father work tirelessly to create the most beautiful and awe-inspiring statues.

One day, Ali asked his father, "How do you create such magnificent works of art?"

His father replied, "My son, it is not just about the clay or the stone. It is about capturing the spirit of the world around us and bringing it to life. It is about understanding the connection between all things and expressing that connection through art."

Ali was fascinated by his father's words, and he begged his father to teach him the ways of the sculptor. His father agreed, and for many years, Ali studied under his father's guidance, learning the secrets of the ancient art of sculpture.

As Ali grew older, he became more and more skilled in the art of sculpture. He began to create his own works of art, each one more magnificent and breathtaking than the last. People would travel from far and wide to see Ali's sculptures and to marvel at the young artist's extraordinary talent.

But Ali was not content to simply create beautiful sculptures. He wanted to create something truly extraordinary, something that would capture the spirit of the world around him and express the connection between all things.

And so, Ali set out on a journey to find the perfect stone, a stone that would become the canvas for his greatest work of art. He searched high and low, traveling to the farthest reaches of the land, until at last, he found the stone he had been looking for.

The stone was enormous, and it was covered in intricate patterns and designs. Ali knew that this was the stone that would become his masterpiece. He worked tirelessly, day and night, to carve and shape the stone, using all of the knowledge and skill that his father had taught him.

As Ali worked, he could feel the spirit of the world around him flowing through him, guiding his hands and shaping the stone. And when he was finished, Ali stood back and marveled at the magnificent statue he had created.

The statue was a breathtaking depiction of a great bird in flight, its wings spread wide and its eyes filled with the wisdom of the ages. The bird seemed to come to life, as if it were about to take flight and soar into the heavens.

Ali's masterpiece was greeted with awe and wonder by the people of Bamiyan. They had never seen anything like it before, and they knew that they were in the presence of something truly extraordinary.

And so, Ali's reputation as a master sculptor spread far and wide, and people would travel from all corners of the earth to see his magnificent works of art.

But Ali never forgot the lesson that his father had taught him. He knew that his sculptures were not just beautiful works of art, but rather, they were living, breathing embodiments of the ancient wisdom and teachings that connected all things.

And with each new sculpture he created, Ali continued to express that connection, sharing the spirit of the world around him with all who came to see his magnificent works of art.

In the end, Ali became known as the greatest sculptor the world had ever known, and his sculptures stood as a testament to the power of art and the beauty of the human spirit.

And as Ali's son, you too have the gift of creativity and the power to express the spirit of the world around you. So always remember to use your gifts wisely, and to share your talents with others, for in doing so, you will help to make the world a more beautiful and harmonious place for all.

And with that, my dear son, it is time for you to close your eyes and drift off to sleep, knowing that the world is full of wonder and magic, and that you have the power to create something truly extraordinary. Goodnight, my dear son. Sweet dreams.
